==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|ぼ|ち|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ほち'}} compound {{m|zh|墓地|tr=mu<sup>H</sup> dij<sup>H</sup>|lit=grave, tomb + ground, region}}. The {{m|ja|漢音|sc=Latn|kan'on}} reading, so likely a later borrowing. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''mùdì'', {{etyl|nan|-}} ''bōng-tē''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=ko|ぼち|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぼち}}

# a [[cemetery]], a [[graveyard]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading is more common than ''hakachi'' below.

In general usage, the Chinese-derived term {{lang|ja|墓地}} (''bochi'') is somewhat more formal than the native-Japanese compound {{m|ja|墓場|tr=hakaba}}. Compare the similar {{etyl|en|-}} terms, with the Latin-derived {{m|en|cemetery}} and the native compound {{m|en|graveyard}}.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|墓場|はかば}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=y|はか|ち}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=はかち|墓|tr1=haka|t1=grave|pos1=from {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=はかち}}|地|tr2=chi|t2=ground, region|pos2=from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=はかち}}}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=y|はかち|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はかち}}

# a [[cemetery]], a [[graveyard]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading is less common than ''bochi'' above.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|墓場|はかば}}
